context_bundle.summary: Behavioral psychology: Classical conditioning (Pavlov, acquisition, extinction, spontaneous recovery), operant conditioning (Skinner, reinforcement schedules, shaping), applied behavior analysis, habit formation/breaking.

onboarding.quick_start: Classical: Pair neutral + unconditioned → conditioned response. Operant: Consequences control behavior. Reinforce what you want, extinguish what you don't. Variable ratio most resistant to extinction.
common_patterns: Classical conditioning: CS-US pairing → CR. Extinction = CS alone. Spontaneous recovery = CR returns after rest
Operant schedules: Fixed ratio (piecework), variable ratio (gambling), fixed interval (salary), variable interval (email)
Reinforcement: Positive (+stimulus), negative (-stimulus). Both INCREASE behavior
Punishment: Positive (+aversive), negative (-pleasant). Both DECREASE behavior - but side effects
known_errors: Confusing negative reinforcement with punishment - reinforcement always increases
Inconsistent reinforcement during acquisition - slows learning
Punishment without alternative - suppresses but doesn't teach replacement
Ignoring context - behavior is function of antecedents AND consequences
